Subject: Re: [neat] Re: Connection innovation IDs
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=344770077; y=kEe98pgR75XdeuVl97nshnvT-O0AyXZQd-rZpnNZ8MS9v0gPEYTJ
X-Yahoo-Profile: alienseedpod
From: Colin Green <colin.green1@...>


--001a1137d93a76469c056115f803
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="UTF-8"

Thanks Ken, Stefano for the feedback.

I agree with all of he points made. My main aim in this refresh of the code
is to keep it functionally equivalent to v 2.x code but with a general tidy
up of the code, the API, and a rethink of some of the core data structures
specifically w.r.t. performance. So the core functionality is to remain the
same but the implementation will be re-written or partially re-written in
some areas.

This is the first thing I've come across where I'm considering a functional
change. The vague plan is to do bolder, more experimental/exploratory
changes in other versions, possibly as spin offs from the main code base.
With this change I'm going to give it a try and re-run my 'efficacy
sampling' tests from earlier in 2017 just to make sure it's OK. I need to
do that anyway because of all the other big implementation changes going
on. If it looks ok I plan to make the change in the core repo.

I'm potentially aiming for a 10x speedup of the core NEAT algorithm and
neural net code just by careful choice of data structures and minimizing
copying data around and re-ordering data etc. There's also use of vector
CPU instructions in the activation functions, and for free I get a lot of
.NET improvements that have been made this year in the JIT compiler and
garbage collector(*). I'm also hoping to support using either double or
single precision floats for a further speedup for those wanting to
experiment with less precision on the connection weights.

(*) I think this version will be a lot lighter on garbage creation, this is
an area I haven't paid much attention to in previous performance
testing/tuning so I'm hopeful this will give a notable performance boost
too.

Regards,

Colin

--001a1137d93a76469c056115f803
Content-Type: text/html; charset="UTF-8"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
